title: Dunvegan Castle Walk Route

images.title: Dunvegancastle, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dunvegan Castle & Gardens. Originally built as a fortress to keep people out, the castle first welcomed visitors in 1933 and has since become one of Skye’s most renowned and award-winning heritage sites. Today, guests can explore a remarkable castle and Highland estate filled with history and clan lore, wander through its beautiful gardens, take a boat trip to observe the local seal colony, enjoy a delicious meal at the MacLeod Tables Cafe, browse three unique shops, and even stay overnight in one of its holiday cottages or at Glenbrittle Campsite.

images.caption: Loch Dunvegan and the Castle

description: This walk visits the 13th century Dunvegan Castle on the Isle of Skye. The historic castle grounds are a fine place for a stroll with lovely gardens, a waterfall and fine views over the adjacent Loch Dunvegan. To continue your walking in the area head west to visit Neist Point the most westerly point on the Duirinish peninsula.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To the south there's the lovely Talisker Bay Beach. Here you will find a lovely, quiet beach with some impressive sea stacks and views to a waterfall.

details.subtitle: Visitor Reviews
details.content: "A gem of history on the Isle of Skye!" Visited August 2023 5 stars By Emily S. "Dunvegan Castle is absolutely fascinating! The guided tour was informative, bringing to life the stories of the MacLeod clan and their history. The gardens are beautifully maintained, and we enjoyed a peaceful walk with some incredible views over the loch. Don’t miss the boat trip to see the seals – it was a real highlight!"  "A unique and scenic experience" Visited July 2023 4.5 stars By Tom K. "The castle and grounds are stunning! The gardens are a real treat, and the castle itself has an impressive collection of artefacts. We also tried the café, which served a nice selection of local dishes. It’s a bit of a drive from other parts of Skye, but well worth it for a day out filled with history and nature. Loved every moment!"  "A highlight of our Skye trip!" Visited June 2023 5 stars By Charlotte R. "Dunvegan Castle is a must-see on Skye. The interior is packed with clan history, and the gardens are so vibrant in the summer. We spent a good few hours here and loved every second. The boat ride to see the seals was magical – they were so close! The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Highly recommend for anyone visiting the island."  "Fantastic gardens and historic atmosphere" Visited September 2022 4 stars By Liam H. "The castle itself is a fascinating glimpse into clan history, but the gardens are what impressed me the most! They’re beautifully designed, with lots of quiet spots to relax and enjoy the scenery. The views over the water are breathtaking, and the boat trip to see the seals was delightful. A bit pricey, but worth it for the experience."  "Perfect mix of history and nature" Visited May 2023 5 stars By Sarah T. "Dunvegan Castle is set in a stunning location with views across the loch. We enjoyed exploring the rooms filled with clan memorabilia, and the gardens were lovely to walk through. Make sure to try the MacLeod Tables Cafe – it has some great Scottish treats. Overall, a perfect day out that combines history, nature, and a bit of adventure!"  "A peaceful and inspiring visit" Visited April 2023 4.5 stars By Jake F. "Visiting Dunvegan Castle felt like stepping back in time. The rooms are well-preserved, and the guides share intriguing details about the MacLeod family’s past. The gardens are lovely and peaceful, with plenty of photo opportunities. We also saw a few seals from the boat tour, which was a memorable part of our day. Highly recommended for history enthusiasts!"

display_address: Dunvegan Castle, Woodland Walk, Totachocaire, Dunvegan, Highland, Alba / Scotland, IV55 8WE, United Kingdom
